trans-unit.source: By accessing and using Portfolio (Product), you acknowledge and agree to the following terms and conditions, and any policies, guidelines, or amendments thereto that may be presented to you from time to time. We, the listed students, may update or change the terms and conditions from time to time without notice.
Scope and ownership of the product

Portfolio has been developed as part of a student group project in a web development bootcamp at the Developer Akademie GmbH. It has an educational purpose and is not intended for extensive personal & business usage. As such, we cannot guarantee consistent availability, reliability, accuracy, or any other aspect of quality regarding this Product.
The design of Portfolio is owned by the Developer Akademie GmbH. Unauthorized use, reproduction, modification, distribution, or replication of the design is strictly prohibited.

Aside from the design owned by Developer Akademie GmbH, we, the listed students, retain all proprietary rights in Portfolio, including any associated copyrighted material, trademarks, and other proprietary information.

Portfolio is intended to be used for lawful purposes only, in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations. Any use of Portfolio for illegal activities, or to harass, harm, threaten, or intimidate another person, is strictly prohibited. You are solely responsible for your interactions with other users of Portfolio.
Disclaimer of warranties and limitation of liability

Portfolio is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind, whether express or implied, including but not limited to the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. In no event will we, the listed students, or the Developer Akademie, be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data, or other intangible losses, even if we have been advised of the possibility of such damages, arising out of or in connection with the use or performance of Portfolio.

You agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless us, the listed students, the Developer Akademie, and our affiliates, partners, officers, directors, agents, and employees, from and against any claim, demand, loss, damage, cost, or liability (including reasonable legal fees) arising out of or relating to your use of Portfolio and/or your breach of this Legal Notice.
For any questions or notices, please contact me at marcelgoehn@googlemail.com
Hey there, I'm Marcel! Since my childhood, I’ve been fascinated by computers and video games – today, I bring my own applications and solutions to life through code.
An icon to represent the location
Currently living in Aurich, Germany. I'm open to work remotely and at the companys office.
An icon with a thinking head
I’m eager to kick off my career as a Fullstack Web Developer and further expand into cloud and mobile app development
As a creative and analytical team player, I like to get challenged with complex problems to learn from them and to further expand my expertise as a Software developer.
What my colleagues say about me

Working with Marcel was always reliable and pleasant. He communicates clearly, thinks ahead, and delivers clean, well-documented code. Deadlines were consistently met, and even during challenging phases, he remained solution-oriented and professional.
Working with Marcel was a pleasure. His quick understanding of complex problems and clean, maintainable code pushed our project forward.
Marcel consistently delivers high-quality work and brings great ideas to the table. His positive attitude keeps the whole team motivated.

Marcel Göhn combines technical skill with a natural sense for teamwork. He not only writes clean and maintainable code, but also contributes valuable ideas that improve the overall project. Whenever unexpected issues appeared, Marcel approached them with creativity and a calm mindset, making him a trusted problem-solver.

It’s rare to meet someone as dependable as Marcel. He takes ownership of his work, delivers on time, and keeps communication transparent. Whether refining details or tackling major features, Marcel shows both precision and dedication, which consistently raises the quality of our results.
Thanks! Your email is on its way. We’ll be in touch soon.
Encourage people to contact you and describe what role you are interested in. Show that you will add value to their projects through your work.
Need a Frontend developer? Let's talk!
Oops! It seems your name is missing
Hello Marcel, I am interested in...
What do you need to develop?
I've read the privacy policy and agree to the processing of my data as outlined.
Task manager inspired by the Kanban System. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.
Jump, run and throw game based on object-oriented approach. Help Pepe to find coins and tabasco salsa to fight against the crazy hen.

This app is a dynamic Pokédex built with HTML, CSS and JavaScript. It fetches Pokémon data from an API and displays each creature with its name, image and type. Users can quickly search and explore different Pokémon in an interactive and responsive interface.
Explore a selection of my work here - Interact withprojects to see my skills in action.
My Join kanban board for tracking tasks
A screenshot of Pepe, the character of El-Pollo-Loco

I create modern, user-friendly web apps with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, strengthened by TypeScript and Angular. Using Material Design, Git, Firebase, and REST APIs, I build clean, scalable solutions. With Scrum experience and a strong growth mindset, I keep learning and adapt quickly to new technologies.
Feel free to contact me. I look forward to expanding on my previous knowledge.
Next technologies I aim to learn

Protecting your personal data is very important to me. I treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy. This privacy policy informs you about what data I collect, how I use it, and what rights you have regarding your data.

This website is hosted via Firebase Hosting. The hosting provider automatically processes your IP address and other technical data when you access the site to ensure its operation. This information is stored in so-called server log files and includes:
IP address of the requesting device
This data is used solely for technical administration and is not merged with other data sources.
Collection and processing of personal data
My website includes a contact form. I collect the following personal data through this form:
This data is used solely to contact you or to provide the website’s features.
Data transmission is encrypted (e.g., via HTTPS, if enabled).
Your personal data is not shared with third parties. No data is transferred outside the European Union.
This website does not use cookies.
No tracking or analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Matomo) are used on this website.
Access the personal data we store (Art. 15 GDPR)
Request deletion of your data (Art. 17 GDPR)
Restrict processing of your data (Art. 18 GDPR)
Object to the processing of your data (Art. 21 GDPR)
To exercise these rights, you can contact me via email: marcelgoehn@googlemail.com
I store your personal data only as long as necessary for the intended purpose or as required by law.
I implement technical and organizational security measures to protect your data against manipulation, loss, destruction, or unauthorized access.
I reserve the right to amend this privacy policy at any time to comply with current legal requirements. The latest version is available on my website under the specified contact address.
